org.apache.oodt.grid

Class ProductQueryServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.apache.oodt.grid.GridServlet
          • org.apache.oodt.grid.QueryServlet
            • org.apache.oodt.grid.ProductQueryServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RestfulProductQueryServlet

    public class ProductQueryServlet
extends QueryServlet
    Product query servlet handles product queries. It always returns the first matching product, if any. If no handler can provide a product, it returns 404 Not Found. If there are no query handlers, it returns 404 Not Found.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getServers

        protected List getServers(Configuration config)
        Get a list of Servers that will provide handlers to handle the query. Subclasses implement this by returning a list of either ProductServers or ProfileServers.
        Specified by:
        getServers in class QueryServlet
        Parameters:
        config - a Configuration value.
        Returns:
        a List value of Servers of some kind.

      • handleQuery

        protected void handleQuery(XMLQuery query,
                           List handlers,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
                    throws IOException
        Handle the query. Subclasses implement this by parsing the query and returning some results.
        Specified by:
        handleQuery in class QueryServlet
        Parameters:
        query - The query to handle.
        handlers - A list of either product QueryHandlers or profile ProfileHandlers.
        req - a HttpServletRequest value.
        res - a HttpServletResponse value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • displayable

        protected static boolean displayable(String contentType)
        Tell if a result is displayable. This compares its MIME type to a list of MIME types commonly displayble by browsers.
        Parameters:
        contentType - MIME type.
        Returns:
        a boolean value.

      • suggestFilename

        protected void suggestFilename(QueryHandler handler,
                               Result result,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
        We can suggest a filename (if the client happens to be a browser) using a content-disposition header.
        Parameters:
        res - a HttpServletResponse value.
